# üêç Python OOP Projects

Welcome to my collection of beginner-friendly **Python Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)** projects!  
Each project is created step-by-step with simplicity, clarity, and learning in mind. üöÄ

---

## üìÇ Projects Included

| Project                     | Description                                                |
|----------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| üê∂ Pet Adoption System      | Add, view, adopt pets with a clean UI using Streamlit       |
| üõí Grocery Billing System   | Add items, calculate bills, and print receipts via console |
| üìì Digital Diary (Note App) | Create, view, delete personal notes with timestamps        |

---

## üìå Objective

These projects are designed to help beginners understand and master:
- Python OOP Concepts (Classes, Objects, Methods, Encapsulation)
- Practical application of logic
- Clean code structuring

---

## üíª How to Run

1. Make sure Python is installed.
2. Clone this repository or download the folder.
3. Navigate to the project folder.
4. Run each `.py` file using:

```bash
python filename.py
) <!-- Replace with your own image if needed -->

# üêç Python OOP Projects

Welcome to my collection of beginner-friendly **Python Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)** projects!  
Each project is created step-by-step with simplicity, clarity, and learning in mind. üöÄ

---

## üìÇ Projects Included

| Project                     | Description                                                |
|----------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| üõí Grocery Billing System   | Add items, calculate bills, and print receipts via console |
| üìì Digital Diary (Note App) | Create, view, delete personal notes with timestamps        |

---

## üìå Objective

These projects are designed to help beginners understand and master:
- Python OOP Concepts (Classes, Objects, Methods, Encapsulation)
- Practical application of logic
- Clean code structuring

---

## üíª How to Run

1. Make sure Python is installed.
2. Clone this repository or download the folder.
3. Navigate to the project folder.
4. Run each `.py` file using:

```bash
python filename.py
